body_html:
@LowBoonKeong In that way, I don't think that's right. I don't think it's a build error. It may be your way of using it is wrong. The right way to use it is to cut the roi_pool.py into the parent dir. Modify the line 3 of the roi_pool.py into the following:

from roi_pooling._ext import roi_pooling

And after that, just call roi_pool.py will be fine.
body:
@LowBoonKeong In that way, I don't think that's right. I don't think it's a build error. It may be your way of using it is wrong. The right way to use it is to cut the `roi_pool.py` into the parent dir. Modify the line 3 of the `roi_pool.py` into the following:
```Python
from roi_pooling._ext import roi_pooling
```
And after that, just call `roi_pool.py` will be fine.
